column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The Art Institute of Chicago is a major museum with all kinds of interesting and surprising collections (coats of armor
column3: ...).  What impressed me especially was the wonderful attitude of the guards/docents who work in the individual galleries.  As we wandered around
column4: we were greeted with enthusiastic welcomes and offers of assistance and information.  The workers told us about their favorite pieces and encouraged us to explore areas that we might have missed.  I had never encountered this behavior in any other museum and am certain that it contributed mightily to my appreciation of the exhibits.
